Biograph.title: Kai Dove
Biograph.subtitle: Full-Stack Software Engineer & ML Engineer
Biograph.description: Computer Science @ University of Virginia | Building production ML systems and scalable web applications | Experienced in Python, React, TensorFlow, and cloud architecture | Proven track record delivering 20%+ performance improvements

About.title: About Me
About.subtitle: Engineering Impactful Software Solutions
About.description: Results-driven Computer Science student at UVA with extensive experience architecting full-stack applications, training deep learning models, and conducting research. Specialized in building scalable systems that process real-world data, from fintech platforms handling financial transactions to ML pipelines analyzing satellite imagery. Strong foundation in algorithms, data structures, and software engineering best practices. Proven ability to deliver measurable impact through clean, maintainable code and innovative problem-solving.

projects.description: Stack: Python, LangChain, GPT-4, FAISS, Streamlit\nRAG-based semantic search system
details: Built RAG-based tool using LangChain and GPT-4 for semantic search over 500+ PubMed abstracts with FAISS vector database, enabling natural language queries across medical research literature with 85% relevance accuracy.

Implemented custom embedding pipeline using sentence-transformers for domain-specific medical terminology, with semantic chunking strategy improving retrieval precision by 40% compared to keyword-based search.

Deployed to Streamlit Cloud serving 50+ student users with response caching and query optimization, reducing average search time from 8 seconds to 1.2 seconds through efficient vector similarity search.

projects.description: Stack: Python, TensorFlow, ResNet50, GIS\nDeep learning for crop yield prediction
details: Collaborated with 2 teammates to build CNN pipeline using ResNet50 with attention pooling for county-level corn yield prediction, processing 10,000+ satellite images (NDVI, DEM, census data) through custom data fusion architecture.

Achieved RÂ² of 0.92 on 150 counties across VA/MD/WV through hyperparameter tuning (Adam optimizer, learning rate scheduling), reducing RMSE by 20% and achieving F1 scores of 0.84+ across 8 crop classifications.

Presented at UVA CS Capstone Showcase demonstrating scalable ML inference pipeline generating actionable crop suitability heatmaps, enabling data-driven agricultural resource allocation and sustainability planning.

projects.insideTitle: Deep Learning Brain Tumor Segmentation System
projects.description: Stack: Python, TensorFlow, U-Net, OpenCV\nReal-time medical image analysis
details: Implemented U-Net architecture for brain tumor segmentation on 200 manually-annotated MRI scans as part of UVA Medical Image Analysis Lab, achieving Dice coefficient improvement from 0.78 to 0.84 on validation set.

Integrated patient data via secure HIPAA-compliant APIs with comprehensive error handling, implementing data augmentation techniques (rotation, flipping, elastic deformation) to improve model generalization across imaging protocols.
Presented findings at UVA Engineering Research Symposium (November 2023), comparing 3 CNN architectures (U-Net, V-Net, ResUNet) for medical image segmentation with quantitative performance metrics.
